ideas.content:
Current price: ~$190
P/E: ~28x
5Y P/E low: ~16x
5Y P/E high: ~35x
EV/EBITDA: ~22x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~13x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~28x
Business: Apple sells premium devices and services to a large installed base.
Mispricing: Market prices Apple like hardware demand will stall, but services mix and ecosystem lock-in support steady EPS growth.

Current price: ~$420
P/E: ~34x
5Y P/E low: ~24x
5Y P/E high: ~38x
EV/EBITDA: ~27x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~19x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~30x
Business: Microsoft sells productivity software and cloud infrastructure with high switching costs.
Mispricing: The market underweights AI copilots and cloud optimization that can drive durable pricing power.

Current price: ~$650
P/E: ~40x
5Y P/E low: ~20x
5Y P/E high: ~60x
EV/EBITDA: ~32x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~16x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~48x
Business: Nvidia supplies GPUs and software that power AI training and inference.
Mispricing: The market assumes AI demand fades quickly, but multi-year deployment cycles can keep utilization elevated.

Current price: ~$170
P/E: ~40x
5Y P/E low: ~35x
5Y P/E high: ~80x
EV/EBITDA: ~32x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~28x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~64x
Business: Amazon runs a massive retail and logistics platform plus AWS cloud services.
Mispricing: Retail margins are improving and AWS can reaccelerate, yet the stock is still priced as a low-margin retailer.

Current price: ~$150
P/E: ~22x
5Y P/E low: ~18x
5Y P/E high: ~32x
EV/EBITDA: ~18x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~14x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~26x
Business: Alphabet dominates search advertising and is scaling Google Cloud.
Mispricing: AI search risk is over-discounted while distribution strength and cloud scale protect cash flows.

Current price: ~$470
P/E: ~24x
5Y P/E low: ~12x
5Y P/E high: ~30x
EV/EBITDA: ~19x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~10x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~24x
Business: Meta monetizes social attention through targeted advertising across its apps.
Mispricing: The market treats AI infra spend as a permanent drag, but efficiency gains can keep margins resilient.

Current price: ~$220
P/E: ~55x
5Y P/E low: ~30x
5Y P/E high: ~180x
EV/EBITDA: ~44x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~24x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~144x
Business: Tesla sells electric vehicles and energy storage with vertically integrated manufacturing.
Mispricing: Near-term auto margins dominate sentiment, while autonomy and energy optionality are underweighted.

Current price: ~$850
P/E: ~33x
5Y P/E low: ~25x
5Y P/E high: ~45x
EV/EBITDA: ~26x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~20x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~36x
Business: ASML supplies lithography tools required for leading-edge chips.
Mispricing: Order timing is cyclical, but EUV demand is structural and backlog durability is undervalued.

Current price: ~$125
P/E: ~22x
5Y P/E low: ~15x
5Y P/E high: ~30x
EV/EBITDA: ~18x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~12x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~24x
Business: TSMC is the leading contract chip manufacturer for advanced nodes.
Mispricing: Geopolitical risk is heavily priced, but node leadership and AI demand support pricing power.

Current price: ~$300
P/E: ~28x
5Y P/E low: ~20x
5Y P/E high: ~45x
EV/EBITDA: ~22x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~16x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~36x
Business: Salesforce provides CRM software embedded in customer workflows.
Mispricing: Growth skepticism ignores margin expansion and AI add-ons that can lift earnings quality.

Current price: ~$22
P/E: ~70x
5Y P/E low: ~35x
5Y P/E high: ~200x
EV/EBITDA: ~56x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~28x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~160x
Business: Palantir sells data platforms to governments and enterprises for complex operations.
Mispricing: The market prices lumpy gov revenue, but platform adoption could broaden the enterprise base.

Current price: ~$190
P/E: ~80x
5Y P/E low: ~50x
5Y P/E high: ~200x
EV/EBITDA: ~64x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~40x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~160x
Business: Snowflake is a cloud data platform with usage-based pricing.
Mispricing: Consumption volatility masks strong data gravity and long-term net retention potential.

Current price: ~$330
P/E: ~18x
5Y P/E low: ~10x
5Y P/E high: ~22x
EV/EBITDA: ~13x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~7x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~15x
Business: Caterpillar sells heavy equipment and engines to construction, mining, and energy customers.
Mispricing: The market prices CAT as late-cycle cyclicality, but backlog quality and aftermarket services support resilient cash flow.

Current price: ~$200
P/E: ~24x
5Y P/E low: ~18x
5Y P/E high: ~27x
EV/EBITDA: ~16x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~12x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~18x
Business: Honeywell sells aerospace, automation, and safety solutions with a large installed base.
Mispricing: The market overlooks software mix and recurring service revenue that can defend margins in a slowdown.

Current price: ~$240
P/E: ~20x
5Y P/E low: ~14x
5Y P/E high: ~26x
EV/EBITDA: ~12x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~9x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~15x
Business: Union Pacific operates a western U.S. rail network with high barriers to entry.
Mispricing: The market treats volume cycles as permanent, but pricing discipline and efficiency gains sustain free cash flow.

Current price: ~$380
P/E: ~12x
5Y P/E low: ~8x
5Y P/E high: ~20x
EV/EBITDA: ~9x
5Y EV/EBITDA low: ~6x
5Y EV/EBITDA high: ~13x
Business: Deere sells agricultural and construction equipment with growing precision ag software.
Mispricing: The market prices peak farm income, but software attach and replacement demand support a higher through-cycle multiple.
